00051 /**
00052 \page analysisstream Architecture: AnalysisStream Tutorial
00053 
00054 The AnalysisStream class is meant to enable routine analysis workflows. The idea
00055 is that a ChipStream list of data transformers are connected to a perfect match
00056 adjuster (PmAdjuster) which then feeds into a summarization method (QuantMethod)
00057 for each ProbeSet, or group of ProbeSets. These analyses can be specified by a
00058 text description and then used relatively easily. Besides the AnalysisStream a
00059  object to specify the physical layout of the probes on the chip and
00060 groups of probes is necessary. Also needed is an IntensityMart to supply the raw
00061 microarray data from all of the chips in the analysis. A schematic of the overall AnalysisStream
00062 process can be seen in Figure 1 below.
00063 
00064 @image html analysisStreamDataProcessSnps.png "Figure 1: Example of an AnalysisStream for genotyping probesets. Raw data from cel files is normalized and then processed with the BRLMM algorithm in the QuantBrlmm class. Actual genotype calls and summary statistics are supplied by reporters that listen for results from Brlmm algorithm."
00065 
00066 For expression GeneChips, the BRLMM quantification method in Figure 1 would be
00067 replaced with another quantification method that summarizes the individual
00068 probes to better estimate overall intensity attributed to the abundance of a
00069 particular transcript in the cell. Figure 2 gives some examples for the
00070 different types of ChipStream data modifications, PmAdjuster methods, and
00071 expression QuantMethods for summarizing results.
00072 
00073 @image html analysisstreamExamples.png "Figure 2: Examples for the different types of ChipStream data modifications, PmAdjuster methods, and expression QuantMethods for summarizing results."
00074 
00075 An example of an AnalyisStream 
00076 process for doing RMA analysis can be found in the
00077 sdk/chipstream/example/simpleRmaExample.cpp file.
00078 
00079 */
00080 
00081 /** Utility class for centralizing analysis pathway */
00082 class AnalysisStream : public SelfDoc, public SelfCreate {
00083 
00084 public:
00085   
00086   /** Constructor. */
00087   AnalysisStream() { 
00088     m_PmAdjust = NULL;
00089     m_QMethod = NULL;
00090     analysisGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00091   }

00095    */

00099    * Delete a stage as it is done processing
00100    */
00101   void cleanupStage(int i) {
00102     Freez(m_CSStages[i]);
00103   }

00106   /** 
00107    * Add a reporter that prints a QC report.
00108    * 
00109    * @param detectedP - P value threshold for detection.
00110    * @param startTime - Time of the start of the run.
00111    * @param QCOut - ofstream to write report to.
00112    */
00113   void addQCReporter(const double detectedP, const time_t startTime, std::ofstream &QCOut);
00114 
00115   /**
00116    * Add a reporter that prints to simple tab delimited file for an
00117    * analysis stream.
00118    *
00119    * @param outDir - directory to output things to.
00120    * @param precision - number of digits after decimal place.
00121    * @param doResiduals - output residual errors.
00122    * @param doFeatureEffects - output feature responses.
00123    */
00124   virtual QuantMethodExprReport* addTextReporter(const std::string& outDir,
00125                                 int precision,
00126                                 bool doResiduals,
00127                                 bool doFeatureEffects);
00128   virtual QuantMethodExprReport* addTextReporter3(const std::string& outDir,
00129                                 int precision_sum,
00130                                 int precision_feff,
00131                                 int precision_res,
00132                                 bool doResiduals,
00133                                 bool doFeatureEffects);

00135   /** 
00136    * Write out the initial text header for a quantification method.
00137    * 
00138    * @param execGuid - Job unique id.
00139    * @param timeStr - When job was run.
00140    * @param commandLine - Command line specified to program.

00143    */
00144   virtual void addStdHeaders(const std::string& execGuid, 
00145                              const std::string& timeStr,
00146                              const std::string& commandLine,
00147                              const std::string& execVersion,
00148                              const AnalysisInfo& info);

00156    * @param commandLine - Command line specified to program.
00157    * @param colNames - Names of columns (usually cel file names).
00158    * @param execVersion - Version, cvs id string.
00159    */
00160   virtual void addStdHeaders(ChipLayout& layout,
00161                              const std::string& execGuid, 
00162                              const std::string& timeStr,
00163                              const std::string& commandLine,
00164                              const std::string& execVersion,

00167   /** 
00168    * Connect a reporter to an analysis stream.
00169    * 
00170    * @param reporter - object to use for output.
00171    */
00172   virtual void addReporter(QuantMethodReport* reporter) {
00173     m_Reporters.push_back(reporter);
00174   }

00176   /** 
00177    * Set the object for adusting perfect match intensities.
00178    * @param pmAdjuster - object for specifying adustments.
00179    */
00180   virtual void setPmAdjuster(PmAdjuster *pmAdjuster) {
00181     m_PmAdjust = pmAdjuster;
00182   }
00183 
00184   /** 
00185    * Set the object for summarizing an individual probe set.
00186    * @param qMethod - Quantification object.
00187    */
00188   virtual void setQuantMethod(QuantMethod *qMethod) {
00189     m_QMethod = qMethod;
00190   }
00191 
00192   /** 
00193    * Add a new chipstream object to the end of the current
00194    * list of chipstream transformation objects.
00195    * 
00196    * @param cStream - New chipstream transformation object.
00197    */
00198   virtual void addChipStream(ChipStream *cStream) {
00199     /* Register as next in chipstream linked list for receiving data. */
00200     if(!m_CStreams.empty()) {
00201       m_CStreams[m_CStreams.size() - 1]->registerStream(cStream);
00202       cStream->registerParent(m_CStreams[m_CStreams.size() - 1]);
00203     }
00204     m_CStreams.push_back(cStream);
00205   }
00206 
00207   /** 
00208    * What should this particular analysis stream be called?
00209    * @param s - New name for analysis stream.
00210    */
00211   void setName(const std::string &s) {
00212     m_Name = s;
00213   }
00214 
00215   /** 
00216    * What is the name of this particular analysis stream?
00217    */
00218   std::string getName() {
00219     return m_Name;
00220   }
00221 
00222   /** 
00223    * Get the beginning of the chipstream list.
00224    * @return - First in the list of chipstream objects.
00225    */
00226   ChipStream *getChipStreamHead() {
00227     if(m_CStreams.empty())
00228       return NULL;
00229     return m_CStreams[0];
00230   }
00231 
00232   /**
00233    * Tell a CelReader what chipstream objects it needs to know about.
00234    * @param reader - 
00235    */
00236   virtual void registerChipStreamObjs(IntensityReader &reader) {
00237     if(getChipStreamHead() != NULL)
00238       reader.registerStream(getChipStreamHead());
00239   }

00241   /** 
00242    * Do the analysis for a particular group of probe sets.
00243    * 
00244    * @param psGroup - Collection of probe sets to get probes from.
00245    * @param iMart - Object containing raw data values for all chips.
00246    * @param doReport - Should the quantification report object be called?
00247    * @param alleleSummaryOnly - A hack to get apt-probeset-genotype to output Axiom .summary files without genotyping.  "People" decided that it was easier to do this than to get apt-probeset-summarize to read dual-channel CEL files.
00248    * 
00249    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00250    */
00251   virtual bool doAnalysis(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00252                           IntensityMart &iMart, 
00253                           bool doReport,
00254                           bool alleleSummaryOnly = false);
00255   /** 
00256    * Get the quantification method used. Useful for getting results after
00257    * doAnalysis() has been called.
00258    * @return - Quantification method for this stream.
00259    */
00260   virtual QuantMethod *getQuantMethod() {
00261     return m_QMethod;
00262   }
00263 
00264   virtual void prepare(const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00265     m_QMethod->prepare(iMart);
00266     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Reporters.size(); i++) {
00267       m_Reporters[i]->prepare(*m_QMethod, iMart);
00268     }
00269   }
00270   
00271   virtual void finish() {
00272     m_QMethod->finish();
00273     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Reporters.size(); i++) {
00274       m_Reporters[i]->finish(*m_QMethod);
00275     }
00276   }
00277 
00278   virtual std::vector<ChipStream *> *getChipStream() {
00279     return &m_CStreams;
00280   }
00281 
00282   virtual PmAdjuster *getPmAdjuster() {
00283     return m_PmAdjust;
00284   }
00285 
00286   std::string getGuid() {
00287     return analysisGuid;
00288   }
00289   
00290   /** 
00291    * Get a formal description of each object in the analysis stream
00292    * including chipstream objects, pm adjuster and quantification
00293    * method. The string description is of the form that SelfCreate
00294    * objects would use to create themselves.
00295    * @return - text description of objects and their state.
00296    */
00297   std::string getAnalysisSpec() { 
00298     std::string description;
00299     std::vector<ChipStream *>::iterator csIx;
00300     for(csIx = m_CStreams.begin(); csIx != m_CStreams.end(); ++csIx) {
00301       description += (*csIx)->getState() + ",";
00302     }
00303     description += m_PmAdjust->getState() + ",";
00304     description += m_QMethod->getState() + ",";
00305     description += getState();
00306     return description;
00307   }
00308 
00309   void setInfo(AnalysisInfo &info) {
00310     m_Info = info;
00311     Verbose::out(1,"Setting analysis info.");
00312     m_QMethod->setAnalysisInfo(info);
00313   }
00314 
00315   AnalysisInfo getInfo() const {
00316     return m_Info;
00317   }
00318 
00319   std::string getOutPrefix() const { 
00320     return m_OutPrefix; 
00321   }
00322 
00323   void setOutPrefix(const std::string &prefix) { 
00324     m_OutPrefix = prefix;
00325   }
00326 
00327   /**
00328    * Get the number of registered reporters.
00329    * @return The number of reporters.
00330    */
00331   int getReporterSize() { return (int) m_Reporters.size(); }
00332 
00333   /**
00334    * Get the reporter, given by an index.
00335    * @return The reporter.
00336    */
00337   QuantMethodReport * getReporter(int index) { return m_Reporters[index]; }
00338 
00339   /// Data transform stages
00340   std::vector<ChipStreamDataTransform *> m_CSStages;
00341 
00342 protected: 
00343 
00344   /// Name of this analysis stream.
00345   std::string m_Name;
00346   /// Chip stream transformers for this analsyis (i.e bg sub)
00347   std::vector<ChipStream *> m_CStreams;
00348 
00349   /// Adjustment to use for this analysis.
00350   PmAdjuster *m_PmAdjust;
00351   /// Quantification method (i.e. plier)
00352   QuantMethod *m_QMethod;
00353   /// Report object for outputting results
00354   std::vector<QuantMethodReport *> m_Reporters;
00355   /// Pseudorandom identifier for this analysis 
00356  std::string analysisGuid;
00357   /// A collection of information about program and analyisis state.
00358   AnalysisInfo m_Info;
00359   /// Output directory prefix where sometimes diagnostic files go.
00360   std::string m_OutPrefix;
00361 };
